185915435.review:
Unless it on sale, don't bother buying it.

The real "meat" of MGSV is in Phantom Pain.
I will say playing in and around camp Omega was pretty fun given it's size, complexity, and density; but since I played Phantom Pain first, I felt how some mechanics weren't fully polished.

That said, if you really care about played as "the real Big Boss", then I guess here's your game.

But if you care about the story of Metal Gear (which is funny since you're already fucked with Phantom Pain's story anyway), then this game really can be boiled down to a cutscene in Phantom Pain........
(wait...... they actually just did that anyway? wow.)

To me... they should've treated this like they treated the Tanker Mission in MGS2; as a separate selectable mission at the start of the game being treated as a prologue. I know this came out years before Phantom Pain as a glorified Fox Engine tech demo (and Konami demanded blood I guess). But what's stopping people from just making Ground Zeroes a purchasable DLC mission and keep MGSV as one package / store page nowadays? It would avoid confusion in the very least.

5/10 I guess, but really only play this if you "must" have the complete Metal Gear V experience. It's not worth $20 for the 30 minutes of integral gameplay you get. That said, the side missions are a fun bonus and can add some value if you care for that sort of stuff.

Cleared it in 96 minutes. Going back for the various collectibles and challenges will pad out gameplay a lot, but this is a brutally short single-mission game even with the amount of cutscenes and time spent talking. Base price seems to be twenty USD at time of writing, so definitely wait for a sale.

That said, it's at least good at what it does. This is among my first exposures to Kojima's work and I am at least now interested in playing more of the MGS series.

184785176.review:
Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes, A New Brief Era

When Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes (GZ) was released in 2014, it stirred a significant amount of conversation and debate among fans of the Metal Gear series and critics alike. Initially criticized for its brevity and its status as a prologue to the larger Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain, Ground Zeroes was nevertheless a landmark entry in the franchise. Its importance lies in several key areas: its technical innovations, storytelling approach, gameplay evolution, and its role in bridging the gap between past and future Metal Gear titles.

A Technological Marvel:

Ground Zeroes was widely praised for its stunning visuals and technical prowess. Powered by the Fox Engine, the game showcased realistic lighting, environmental detail, and character models that were ahead of their time. Dynamic weather, realistic physics, and fluid animations created an immersive experience that set the stage for future open world games.

The Fox Engine’s capabilities were also demonstrated in its seamless transitions between cutscenes and gameplay, eliminating loading screens and offering a more cohesive narrative experience. This was a marked departure from the earlier Metal Gear games, where cutscenes were distinctly separated from gameplay.

Gameplay Revolution, Stealth Reimagined:

The Metal Gear Solid series is synonymous with stealth, and Ground Zeroes marked a bold evolution in this regard. Unlike its predecessors, which were more linear in design, Ground Zeroes introduced a semi-open-world environment with multiple ways to approach objectives. Players were given more freedom than ever before to decide how to infiltrate the Cuban military camp known as Camp Omega.

Key gameplay improvements included:
Non-linear level design: Players could explore the camp from different angles, with multiple entry points and paths, allowing for creative problem-solving.
Enhanced AI: Enemy soldiers exhibited improved intelligence, reacting to sounds, changes in their environment, and player tactics with greater realism.
Dynamic mechanics: Features like enemy tagging, light manipulation, and vehicle usage added depth to the stealth gameplay.

These innovations not only modernized Metal Gear’s core gameplay but also influenced later stealth and open world games in the industry.

Narrative, Thematic Maturity and Much Darker Tone:

Ground Zeroes represented a tonal shift for the series. While Metal Gear had always dealt with serious themes, war, politics, nuclear proliferation, earlier entries often balanced these with a degree of levity and eccentricity. In contrast, Ground Zeroes embraced a darker, more grounded narrative, setting the stage for The Phantom Pain.

The story follows Big Boss (Snake) as he infiltrates Camp Omega to rescue Paz and Chico, key characters from Metal Gear Solid: Peace Walker. The game’s short narrative arc is heavy with political subtext, addressing themes such as torture, child soldiers, and the moral ambiguity of war. The harrowing ending of Ground Zeroes serves as a catalyst for the events of The Phantom Pain, highlighting the traumatic transformation of Big Boss and his descent into becoming a legendary warlord.

The shift toward a more serious tone was a bold creative decision by Hideo Kojima, setting Ground Zeroes apart as a mature entry that demanded reflection from its players.

A Bridge to the Future:

Perhaps the most significant role of Ground Zeroes was as a prologue to The Phantom Pain. It introduced players to the new mechanics, tone, and themes that would define the larger game. By serving as a standalone experience, it provided a testbed for the game engine, player feedback, and Kojima’s vision for a modern open world stealth game.

The smaller scope of Ground Zeroes allowed players to become familiar with the new controls and systems before diving into the much larger world of The Phantom Pain. The prologue’s story directly leads into the events of The Phantom Pain, making it essential for those who want a full understanding of Big Boss’s character arc.

Controversies & Criticism:

Despite its innovations, Ground Zeroes was not without its controversies. One of the most notable criticisms was its length. With the main mission taking only 1-2 hours to complete, many felt that the price tag was too high for what seemed like a glorified demo. However, those who delved deeper will find a wealth of content in the form of side missions, collectibles, and alternate approaches to objectives, significantly expanding the game’s replayability and lore.

Another point of contention was the tonal shift. While some appreciated the darker, more mature themes, others missed the quirky charm of earlier entries in the series.

Legacy and Influence:

Ground Zeroes left a lasting impact on the Metal Gear series and the gaming industry as a whole. Its open ended approach to stealth gameplay influenced other open world games, pushing the boundaries of how freedom and player agency can be integrated into a traditionally linear genre.

Moreover, it highlighted the potential of prologues as standalone experiences. While its initial reception was mixed, Ground Zeroes is now often viewed as an essential and experimental part of the Metal Gear saga, a bold precursor to one of the most ambitious games of its generation.

Conclusion:

Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes is a crucial piece of Metal Gear history. Despite early criticism, it has come to be appreciated for its role in revolutionizing stealth gameplay, advancing technical standards, and exploring mature narrative themes. As both a standalone experience and a prelude to The Phantom Pain, it holds a unique and significant place in gaming history, embodying Hideo Kojima’s willingness to innovate and take risks.
Whether viewed as a prologue or a game in its own right, Ground Zeroes remains an important milestone in the evolution of the Metal Gear series, offering fans a glimpse into the future of open world stealth and storytelling. It may not be the longest or most traditional entry, but its influence and importance are undeniable.

184776364.review:
After getting the 100% and all achievements, I can say for sure that this game is more of what people make of it. "It's a $40 demo" or "It's the younger brother of TPP", both of these statements are incorrect. GZ is a good game with a lot of the mechanics of TPP, also has a lot of details and nostalgia that made MGS a great saga. 

Some of these details disappeared in TPP, one of them being BB face having an expression of each situation. 

The missions available are very special and the freedom that you have to resolve each situation make this a perfect experience for beginners who want to play TPP and I recommend it, but with a discount due to the size and, maybe and just maybe, the boredom that you get when trying to collect all of the achievements and S ranks.

PD. KOJIMA IS GOD!

184311457.review:
It is a tech test and direct prequel to The Phantom Pain; if you want the full story, you must play it before diving into The Phantom Pain. 

This demo is often on sale, so PLEASE DO NOT BUY IT AT FULL PRICE!!!! 

The primary mission is absolutely jaw-dropping. Snake, AKA Big Boss, sneaks into a US Black site guarded by United States Marines. He races against the clock to rescue his former PMC soldiers who are being held hostage, all while a secret task force leaves the base en route to Snakes Home Base for an "inspection". The stakes are high in this explosive start to one of the greatest stealth games ever made!

184086124.review:
I saw a lot of reviews commenting that the game is short. Yeah, it seems to be too short, indeed, compared to its price and even current discounts. Although I enjoy playing this game, I still give a negative review as I strongly do not recommend anyone to spend money on this short game. It's just an introductory game before Phantom Pain.

Actually, for me, short is fine; but the game should be short and profound (not just short). This game, on the other hand, feels repetitive and lacks variety. It reused the same maps for side missions and offers no exciting features. All about the gameplay is just stealth, distracting enemies, knocking them out, and hiding bodies—repeated over and over. It gets boring quickly, as you spend more time watching AI move than actually moving your own character.

184042780.review: This is a console game and playing it with a keyboard and mouse is just frustrating. Using a sniper rifle is a two mouse button and a keyboard key combo and pressing them in the wrong order brings up the binoculars instead. Switching between sniping and an smg means pressing and holding a number and then rolling the scroll wheel exactly one tick. These are pretty precise inputs to expect in a situation that is most likely unexpected and on a very short timer. Between this and Ghost Recon, GR wins hands down in everything except performance. GR is basically unoptimized, it runs badly on anything and everything whereas MGS is content to chug along at +50fps on my windows tablet with an Intel iGPU.

183848841.review:
[i]“Ще один день, ще одна місія для Біґ Боса.”[/i]

[b]Рецензія на Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes[/b]

[b]Графіка:[/b]

Ground Zeroes демонструє потужність рушія Fox Engine. Локація військової бази виглядає деталізовано, освітлення динамічне, а дощ додає атмосферності. Незважаючи на обмежену площу, графіка чудово передає напругу нічної місії.

[b]Геймплей:[/b]

Гра пропонує відкриту локацію для виконання головної місії та кількох додаткових завдань. Вперше в серії акцент зроблено на відкритий світ із широкими можливостями для стелсу. Гравець може вибирати між безшумним проходженням або прямими сутичками, використовуючи різноманітну зброю та гаджети.

Однак локація одна, і це значно обмежує різноманітність. Основна місія займає лише годину, що викликало багато критики через малу тривалість гри.

[b]Сюжет:[/b]

Події Ground Zeroes слугують прологом до The Phantom Pain та розгортаються навколо спроби Біґ Боса врятувати двох заручників. Сюжет передає напругу, притаманну серії, але відчувається уривчасто, залишаючи більше питань, ніж відповідей.

[b]Музика та звук:[/b]

Саундтрек динамічний і чудово доповнює напружені моменти. Озвучка на висоті, зокрема Кейфер Сазерленд у ролі Біґ Боса виконав свою роботу переконливо. Звуковий дизайн створює атмосферу постійної загрози.

[b]Недоліки:[/b]

Дуже коротка основна кампанія.

Обмежена локація.

Відсутність різноманітності у завданнях.


[b]Оцінка:[/b]

Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes отримує 7/10. Це технічно якісна гра, яка більше нагадує демо-версію, ніж повноцінний продукт.

[b]Підсумок:[/b]

Якщо ви фанат серії Metal Gear Solid і хочете дізнатися передісторію The Phantom Pain, Ground Zeroes варта уваги. Але якщо ви шукаєте повноцінну гру, її тривалість може розчарувати. Це гарна, але надто коротка пригода.

183797442.review: As an introduction to the first fully open world Metal Gear Solid universe Ground Zeroes packs a surprising amount of content into what is essentially entry level.  As Metal Gear Solid is well known for you can either choose to implement a stealth approach or a full on action assault or a mixture of the two.  A great back story and a wide variety of mission types set upon a single base provide decent replayability.  I would highly recommend for either newcomers to the genre or veterans of the combat espionage franchise.

183723041.review: Cine. La mejor media hora de todas

183642153.review: Totally a must-play pre-Phantom Pain, but screw finding all of those patches while trying to get an S rank.

183574450.review:
[h1]戦争は変わった...[/h1]
[b] METAL GEAR SOLID PEACE WALKER [/b]後に何が起こったのか、
何故、「平和が終わり、[i]V[/i]が目覚める」ことになったのか、
こちらは [b]METAL GEAR SOLID V: THE PHANTOM PAIN[/b] を
より楽しむためのゲームです。いわばプロローグにあたります。


[h2]ゲーム内容[/h2]
プロローグのミッションや数種類のサブミッションをプレイできます。
ゲーム体験自体は短く感じるかもしれませんが、やりこみ要素が豊富です。
当時の小島秀夫監督の遊び心を感じられると思います。[u]懐かしのあのネタも....[/u]


[h3]ゲームをプレイした感想[/h3]
メタルギアは期待を裏切らないなと当時感じており、
Steamでプレイしてからも、「これなんだよな」と感じされるゲームでした。
キーマウでもPADでも問題なくプレイできます。
個人的にはやはりPADが良いかなと思いますが、自分の好きな方でプレイして下さい。


[h3]購入検討者へ[/h3]
[spoiler]セール時、￥1,558（-40%）で購入できます。
また、ファントムペイン(本編)とセットでは
￥2,626（-40%）購入できます。
安く買いたい人はセール時がいいでしょう。[/spoiler]
